titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Robert Southey Papers, n.d.
titlestmt.subtitle: Southey, Robert Papers Ms1987-018

publicationstmt.date: Â©2014 By Virginia Tech. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-11-07T13:25-0500

titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections Ms1987-018

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The collection consists of eight manuscript pages with fragments of prose that are likely unpublished, written by Robert Southey. Topics include atheists, devils, and extracts of letters on the Irish.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from Robert Southey Papers must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Robert Southey Papers, Ms1987-018, Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Robert Southey Papers were acquired by Special Collections prior to 1987.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Robert Southey Papers was completed in 1987. Additional description was completed in April 2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Robert Southey (1774-1843) was a British poet and writer of prose. After Walter Scott refused, Southey became poet laureate (1813-1843). He was a contributor to The Quarterly Review, a Tory journal, from 1809-1838.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of eight manuscript pages with fragments of prose that are likely unpublished, written by Robert Southey. Topics include atheists, devils, and extracts of letters on the Irish. Transcripts available.
